text: language notes topic six hand gestures
part one some people love to talk with
their hands even if you're not that
expressive when you speak it's still
helpful to be familiar with common hand
gestures hand gestures differ from
culture to culture but that's one more
reason why this topic is important to
cover let's start with some basic

hand in English this is your palm if
this is your palm this is the back of
your hand you move your hand with your
wrist these parts are my knuckles and
the very tips are called the fingertips
the very ends
okay next we're going to name each
finger do you know the names of the five
fingers in English let's start with this
one this is your thumb we point with our
pointer or index finger in the middle we
have our middle finger and in this
lesson I do not plan to cover any
obscene gestures that's just an okay
next to the middle finger is our ring
finger because many people wear a ring
on that fourth finger and finally we
have our little finger many people use
the word pinky I've seen different
spellings I've seen it with a Y and I've
seen it with an IE I think I usually use
a Y thumb pointer or index finger middle
finger ring finger pinky we can use our
index finger to point to things
however it's generally not polite to
point at people I could say you and use
one finger but an alternative is to use

we can also use the whole hand to

you and a

it's different from going back and forth

that's the thumbs up sign we use a

so that's the thumbs down I don't like
it I don't approve I will not use

the okay sign
also a sign of approval how about this
one someone will say high-five they're

it up in the air
what are they doing they want you to
respond with a high five all five
fingers usually that's a sign of
congratulations could be a greeting but
usually a sign of congratulations the
next group of gestures are all somehow
connected to peace or not talking I'm

I won't tell anyone your secret
similarly children might use this one
cross my heart and hope to die I promise
I won't tell anyone I promise
so crossing your heart and lifting your
hand showing your palm for a pledge
means you're promising if you cross
fingers and place them behind your back
children usually do this because there's
a superstition that says then it's okay
to tell a lie right so someone could say
I promise I'm telling the truth really
I'm telling the truth so crossed fingers
behind the back means what you're saying
is not really true you know it's not
true but because you've crossed your
fingers you think it's okay last one the
V sign could be used for peace or for
